divs: sighting detailsi hadn't thought much about this event for many years but am now interested in it again. i am estimating i was about 12 years old which puts this event in the 1967 time frame. sorry i don't have a better date. i remember it was a very nice summer day and i was on summer vacation from school. i had gone out in to our back yard to play about 9am. temperature was very pleasant (i remember having a t-shirt). i could hear the pounding of the drop hammers at the local forging factory several blocks away (american logging tool). the sky was beautiful and had occational big puffy fair weather clouds floating by (can't remember their direction). i looked up in the sky to the west and saw something. i thought at first it was an aircraft and i loved aircraft so continued watching. it was tracking straight from west to east and came right over our back yard. i saw a show on tv a while back (discovery or history channel) and they showed a picture that clicked as to being very similar to what i saw. that is what piqued my interest in learning more about this ufo. it appears to be in the cigar classification. it was silver in color and the closest shape i could liken it to is the goodyear blimp on the ends. some pictures i have seen look more pointed than my object and just don't fit. the object did not have any lights. the object was totally silent. i remember birds (robins) singing the entire time. the very odd thing was the object was rotating. not in a spiral like a football but about its lateral axis (like a boomarang). i would estimate its rotational rate to be 1 revolution per second. as i said it tracked in a perfectly straight line from west to east. i yelled at my mom to come out and see but she said she was busy. i yelled again and she yelled back she was on the phone. so i just stood there and watched. the total trip was about 30 seconds. it passed below the clouds. i have been unable to find anything similar in the time period i have estimated (+\2 years in michigan (or elsewhere in this region). i had pretty much forgotten about the incident. i worked for mcdonnell douglas in flight test for many years and saw a lot of very cool stuff. i have worked with structures, flight controls and propulsions groups and nothing i have worked with would give me any clues to what i saw. when i saw the picture on tv it clicked and i remember thinking "damn, what was that thing?". i am also a licensed private pilot. in reviewing your points to be covered i would like to mention the flight path of the object and its maneuvering were not radom or irratic. everything was smooth and deliberate. there were no course changes or apparent altitude. my feelings were neutral. i didn't know what it was and i was looking at it with more wonder than anything. i was not afraid of it. afterwards i returned to my playing and bike riding. i lost sight of the object as it traveled east and traveled beyond the tree line. i would love to see some pictures of cigar shaped objects to see if i could identify it. when i see it i will know. it is hard to estimate the size as i don't know what it's altitude was. something in the area of 100 feet long and maybe 30 feet in diameter would probably get in the ballpark of size and proportions. rounded ends, not very pointy though.
